A Component_part_2d_geometric_representation_relationship is a type of . A Component_part_2d_geometric_representation_relationship is the association between a or a and the that is the occurrence of that planar shape. If the type of the shape representation of the assembly is different from the type of the shape representation of the part, the Component_part_2d_geometric_representation_relationship allows a processor to create a shape rep of the assembly type and establish an equivalency relationship between that shape representation and the part shape representation. If the shape representation of the assembly is of the same type as the part shape representation, the Component_part_2d_geometric_representation_relationship shall reference the same shape representation as both the part_shape and the component_shape. That instance shall be a complex instance of the part shape and of the component shape.

ext_description.p: A Component_2d_location may be either a , a , a , or a . The Component_2d_location is the placement location, including orientation and mirroring, specified by a combination of description characteristics, substrate surface identification, and two-dimensional transformation. Mirroring shall not be applied to the location of a base substrate. Mirroring applied to components other than a base substrate shall indicate that the components are mounted on the surface of the substrate opposite to the primary surface. When this application object is used in this manner, there shall be only one base substrate in the assembly. Mirroring shall not be applied to . Support for mirroring option is mandatory for to support components mounted on the bottom surface. The transformation matrix value of +1.0 shall indicate primary surface mounted component (un-mirrored). The transformation matrix value of -1.0 shall indicate secondary surface mounted component (mirrored). A mirror requirement to mirror about the local Y axis indicates that values on the Y axis are invariant, while values on the X axis are assigned the negative of the original value.
ext_description.example: A point at (X = 3,Y = 2) would be at (X = -3,Y = 2) after being mirrored.
ext_description.note: This standard does not support a "mounting style" attribute. components which are altered from their normal mounting arrangement (e.g., "upside down mounting style") are considered to be in the context of this standard if the normal mounting arrangement is available and a relationship to that normal mounting arrangement is desired.

Subtypes of this application object includes sufficient information to accurately determine machine parameters for reliable installation of a component on an interconnect substrate. The use of this application object should be reservered for locating base substrates that are not themselves mounted in the design, or where the only mating condition information is encoded in the transformation.
A may be for a surface whether or not there are actually components in the assembly. It is an expression of the design intent behind the creation of the .
A may also be mirrored to communicate the intent that the shape information is different for the bottom vs top arrangement.

Mirroring in this case is only related to the geometric information on the individual stratum for and . Mirroring has nothing to do with the relative location of in the vertical stack. That arrangement will not be modified by the mirror operation and must be adjusted if necessary in the pre-processor.
